item.title: Problems using AudioServicesPlaySystemSound with openEars
item.dc:creator: radox1
item.description:
I am trying to use AudioServicesPlaySystemSound to play a small beep when the system is ready to take voice input (similar to Siri). However this does not seem to work on iOS 6 when using OpeanEars. It is working on the simulator and the same play sound code will work on the device before startListeningWithLanguageModelAtPath is called.

Any ideas why it is not working on the device? Or any tips on ways to play a small beep when ready for voice input?

item.title: Reply To: Problems using AudioServicesPlaySystemSound with openEars
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
This is due to the audio session settings used by the framework. If you want to sidestep the entire issue, just play the sound with AVAudioPlayer. Otherwise you can take a look at the approaches from me and others in these threads:
